title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message.
OB: When invoking 'New Java Package', a message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' appears at the top even before typing anything. The package name field is empty at this point. The user is unsure about the meaning of this message and whether it indicates an error. There is a suggestion to display this message in red with the error icon when it is an error.
EB: The message should be removed when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled. Also, provide a clear explanation for this message to avoid confusion.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new Java project. 
2. Select the created project. 
3. Invoke the 'New Java Package' option from the menu.
